author: Brentski
title: Four Wheeling fun
review:
The creator 3 in 1 sets are a  great value for the money. The primary build on this set has a high degree of playability, I especially like how the secondary and tertiary builds flow...drive to the woods, then do some adventures, and finally camp. I am considering get another one or two to be able to use all the listed configurations together.

The buildable dog is a great example of what to do with a couple small pieces. This is a set I enjoy dis/re assembling from primary to secondary to tertiary build.

The pieces in the set are good, some are a bit specialized, but easily mesh with other parts.

Although  I mostly diorama/model Lego stuff, I consider this a highly playable set. It practically begs to be tinkered with and to use the dog for fun stuff.

Overall, a great value, I think a good purchase for AFOL and children alike.

author: j_d
title: Outback Adventures
review:
OUTBACK ADVENTURES

This set includes an off-roading  vehicle, a cute dog, a simple minifig, a log, and a stump.

The vehicle features working winch, clips for shovel and pickaxe, headlights, gas and oil cans in the back,seats and steering wheel, and a very nicely built rollcage.

Pros

The winch action works smoothly and the main build is both playable and displayable.

Cons

The 2 other builds don't look very interesting.
